intro: Verbesina paucicephala, commonly known as the slender beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with prominent central disks. Verbesina paucicephala is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and its role in supporting local pollinators.
